text: A perfect summer tune to transport yourself on a sandy beach with a refreshing drink. I loved this kingdom with the freedom of running around the beach and diving in the vast underwater, just a feel-good level. A lot of people might also remember it for the volleyball mini-game, but I surprisingly didn't have too much trouble getting that moon (unlike the jump rope challenge in New Donk City).
author: SupraDarky

text: I'm the other way, I got the jump rope moons easily but I had to use the 2p exploit for the volleyball ones.
author: Hawlo

text: Can we talk that this man is still doing this series 12 years later? What a trooper.
author: Jett James

text: The only theme that might slightly help me stop stressing about all the work I haven't been doing from my online classes at home. It's not that I'm lazy, I really just can't concentrate at all and any time I try and do any of it my brain just starts melting.

text: This world was definitely the superior of the two water levels in the game. It felt a lot more expansive and fun to explore than the lakeside kingdom and its music is a lot nicer to listen to imo.

text: Do you think Nintendo will do a surprise reveal for SMO2 like they did with the new Paper Mario?
author: Konata Izumi

text: I've read that Nintendo isn't planning a Direct anytime soon because they are having challenges in terms of their marketing team during this crisis. It's why they revealed Paper Mario through Twitter of all platforms, so at this point... anything is possible. I'd still bank on something huge like SMO2 being revealed during a later Direct though.
